title: PAD-US 4.1 Combined - Protected Areas Database of the United States
description: The Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) 4.1 Combined layer integrates all protection types (fee ownership, easements, proclamation boundaries, marine areas, and designations) into a comprehensive national inventory of 656,986 protected areas. Managed by USGS Gap Analysis Project (GAP), this authoritative dataset combines federal, state, local, and private conservation lands indexed by H3 hexagons. Most features are at resolution 10 (~15m² cells), with 20 extremely complex geometries at resolution 8 (~0.74 km² cells). IMPORTANT: Features may overlap - a single location can have multiple protection types.
license_other: Public Domain (U.S. Government Work) - Not subject to copyright protection within the United States (17 U.S.C. § 105). International rights may apply.

links.title: Detailed Data Documentation and Usage Examples

geoparquet.title: GeoParquet file with all 656,986 protected areas
geoparquet.description: Cloud-native GeoParquet format optimized for analytical queries. Use with DuckDB, Polars, pandas, or any GeoParquet-compatible tool. Geometries in EPSG:4326.

pmtiles.title: PMTiles for web mapping
pmtiles.description: Pyramid of map tiles in PMTiles format. Supports zoom levels 0-14 for efficient web map rendering.

h3-parquet.title: H3 hex-indexed parquet files
h3-parquet.description: Parquet files partitioned by H3 cell at resolution 10 (15m²) and resolution 8 (0.74 km²) for 20 complex features. Partitioned by h0 for efficient spatial queries. Each row contains a protected area feature with its intersecting H3 cell.

table:columns.name: _cng_fid
table:columns.description: Cloud-native geometry feature ID. Unique identifier for each protected area feature. Use this for joining between GeoParquet and H3 hex formats.

table:columns.name: FeatClass
table:columns.description: Feature class indicating the type of protection: 'Fee' (owned), 'Easement' (conservation easement), 'Designation' (administrative boundary), 'Marine' (marine protected area), or 'Proclamation' (authorized boundary).

table:columns.name: Category
table:columns.description: GAP stewardship category: 'Federal Land', 'State Land', 'Local Land', 'Private Conservation Land', 'Joint Ownership', or 'Designation Area'. Indicates the general classification of land stewardship.

table:columns.name: Own_Type
table:columns.description: Owner type code: FED (Federal), STAT (State), LOC (Local), PVT (Private), JNT (Joint), TRIB (Tribal), TERR (Territorial), DIST (District), NGO (Non-Governmental Organization). Indicates who holds title to the land.

table:columns.name: Own_Name
table:columns.description: Owner name. Specific agency, organization, or entity that holds legal title to the protected area. Examples: 'Department of Defense', 'The Nature Conservancy', 'California State Parks'.

table:columns.name: Loc_Own
table:columns.description: Local owner name. Owner name in local terminology or original language when different from Own_Name. May be null if same as Own_Name.

table:columns.name: Mang_Type
table:columns.description: Manager type code. Uses same codes as Own_Type (FED, STAT, LOC, PVT, JNT, TRIB, TERR, DIST, NGO). Indicates the type of entity responsible for day-to-day management, which may differ from ownership.

table:columns.name: Mang_Name
table:columns.description: Manager name. Agency or organization responsible for day-to-day management and operations. Examples: 'National Park Service', 'U.S. Forest Service', 'State Wildlife Agency'. May differ from Owner.

table:columns.name: Loc_Mang
table:columns.description: Local manager name. Manager name in local terminology when different from Mang_Name. May be null if same as Mang_Name.

table:columns.name: Des_Tp
table:columns.description: Designation type code. Standardized code for the type of designation (e.g., 'NP' for National Park, 'NWR' for National Wildlife Refuge, 'WILD' for Wilderness). See PAD-US Designation_Type lookup table for complete list.

table:columns.name: Loc_Ds
table:columns.description: Local designation. Official designation name in original language or local terminology. Examples: 'Parque Nacional', 'Área Natural Protegida'.

table:columns.name: Unit_Nm
table:columns.description: Unit name. Official name of the protected area as designated by the managing authority. Primary identifier for the site.

table:columns.name: Loc_Nm
table:columns.description: Local name. Alternative, historical, or local name for the protected area when different from Unit_Nm. May be null if no alternative name exists.

table:columns.name: State_Nm
table:columns.description: State name. U.S. state, territory, or freely associated state where the protected area is located. Two-letter postal abbreviations (e.g., 'CA', 'PR', 'GU').

table:columns.name: Agg_Src
table:columns.description: Aggregator source. Organization that compiled or aggregated the data, often state agencies or regional coordination entities that collected source data into PAD-US.

table:columns.name: GIS_Src
table:columns.description: GIS source. Original GIS data provider or source dataset name. Indicates where the spatial data came from (e.g., agency name, dataset title).

table:columns.name: Src_Date
table:columns.description: Source date. Date of the source GIS data in YYYYMMDD or YYYY format. Indicates when the source spatial data was created or last updated by the providing agency.

table:columns.name: GIS_Acres
table:columns.description: GIS-calculated area in acres. Most reliable area measure, calculated from the geometry. Use this field for area calculations and comparisons.

table:columns.name: Source_PAID
table:columns.description: Source Protected Area ID. Unique identifier from the source agency's dataset. Used to track provenance and updates from source systems.

table:columns.name: WDPA_Cd
table:columns.description: World Database on Protected Areas (WDPA) site code. Assigned to sites that are internationally recognized and included in the WDPA. Null for sites not in WDPA.

table:columns.name: Pub_Access
table:columns.description: Public access code: OA (Open Access - generally open to public), RA (Restricted Access - limited or seasonal access), XA (Closed/No Public Access), UK (Unknown). Indicates whether and how the public can access the area.

table:columns.name: Access_Src
table:columns.description: Access source. Source of the public access information (e.g., agency website, management plan, direct contact with manager).

table:columns.name: Access_Dt
table:columns.description: Access date. Date the public access status was determined or verified in YYYYMMDD or YYYY format.

table:columns.name: GAP_Sts
table:columns.description: GAP Status Code indicating level of biodiversity management mandate: '1' = Permanent protection, biodiversity as primary goal (e.g., designated wilderness); '2' = Permanent protection, biodiversity as primary or major goal; '3' = Permanent protection, multiple uses (may permit extractive uses); '4' = No known biodiversity mandate. Critical for conservation gap analysis.

table:columns.name: GAPCdSrc
table:columns.description: GAP Code source. Source document or authority used to assign the GAP Status Code (e.g., enabling legislation, management plan, agency policy).

table:columns.name: GAPCdDt
table:columns.description: GAP Code date. Date the GAP Status Code was assigned or verified in YYYYMMDD or YYYY format.

table:columns.name: IUCN_Cat
table:columns.description: IUCN Protected Area Management Category: Ia (Strict Nature Reserve), Ib (Wilderness Area), II (National Park), III (Natural Monument or Feature), IV (Habitat/Species Management Area), V (Protected Landscape/Seascape), VI (Protected Area with Sustainable Use of Natural Resources). International standard for protected area classification.

table:columns.name: IUCNCtSrc
table:columns.description: IUCN Category source. Source document or authority used to assign the IUCN Category (e.g., management objectives, legislation).

table:columns.name: IUCNCtDt
table:columns.description: IUCN Category date. Date the IUCN Category was assigned or verified in YYYYMMDD or YYYY format.

table:columns.name: Date_Est
table:columns.description: Date established. When the protected area protection was formally established (legislation signed, easement recorded, etc.). Format varies: YYYYMMDD, YYYY, or text description for historical areas.

table:columns.name: Comments
table:columns.description: Comments. Additional information, caveats, special notes, or clarifications about the protected area feature. May include data quality notes, boundary uncertainties, or historical context.

table:columns.name: Term
table:columns.description: Term flag. Indicates temporary protection: 1 = temporary or term-limited protection; 0 or NULL = permanent protection. Used to identify conservation easements or agreements with expiration dates.

table:columns.name: Duration
table:columns.description: Duration. Description of protection duration for term-limited protections (e.g., '20 years', 'until 2050', 'renewable 10-year terms'). Null for permanent protections.

table:columns.name: SHAPE_Length
table:columns.description: Shape length. Perimeter length in meters calculated in the original coordinate reference system (USA Contiguous Albers Equal Area Conic). For reference only - recalculate in appropriate CRS for analysis.

table:columns.name: SHAPE_Area
table:columns.description: Shape area. Area in square meters calculated in the original coordinate reference system (USA Contiguous Albers Equal Area Conic). For reference only - use GIS_Acres for area comparisons.

table:columns.name: SHAPE
table:columns.description: Geometry. Well-Known Binary (WKB) representation of the protected area boundary in EPSG:4326 (WGS84). Typically MULTIPOLYGON geometry type. Use for spatial operations and mapping.

table:columns.name: bbox
table:columns.type: struct<xmin: double, ymin: double, xmax: double, ymax: double>
table:columns.description: Bounding box. Minimum bounding rectangle of the geometry with coordinates in EPSG:4326. Useful for spatial indexing and quick extent checks without processing full geometry.
